measured_by: Single-item core moral beliefs & convictions rating (Skitka & Morgan, 2014)
justification: The methods state: "Moral convictions were measured with the following item (Skitka and Morgan 2014): 'To what extent is your position on this a reflection of your core moral beliefs and convictions?' (1 = 'Not at all', 7 = 'Very much')."
The survey "included the 40-item Justice Sensitivity Inventory (JSI) to measure trait sensitivity to injustices against oneself or others (Schmitt et al. 2010)."

topic_or_construct: Opinions on social and political issues
justification: "Opinions on specific social and political issues ... were assessed with an updated 30-item version of the Wilson-Patterson Inventory (adapted from Fessler et al., 2017)."

measured_by: Mean of two self-placement items on social and economic orientation (7-point scales)
justification: "Overall political orientation was calculated as the mean response to the following questions: 'How would you describe your political orientation with regard to social issues?' and 'How would you describe your political orientation with regard to economic issues?' (1 = 'Very liberal', 7 = 'Very conservative')."
